abstract.text: Encodes a command that copies image data from a texture slice to a buffer, and provides options for special texture formats.

The number of bytes between adjacent rows of pixels in the destination buffer’s memory, which needs to be:
A multiple of the source texture’s pixel size, in bytes

The number of bytes between each 2D image of a 3D texture. This value needs to be a multiple of the source texture’s pixel size, in bytes.
An option set that applies to textures with applicable pixel formats, such as combined depth/stencil or PVRTC formats.

abstract.text: A type that presents a mathematical set interface to a bit set.
A false value.
Render advanced 3D graphics and compute data in parallel with graphics processors.
An interface you can use to encode GPU commands that copy and modify the underlying memory of various Metal resources.
Encodes a command that copies image data from a texture slice to a buffer.
Encodes a command that copies image data from a texture slice to a buffer, and provides options for special texture formats.
The options that enable behavior for some blit operations.
A blit option that clears other blit options, which removes any optional behavior for a blit operation.
A blit option that copies the depth portion of a combined depth and stencil texture to or from a buffer.
A blit option that copies PVRTC data between a texture and a buffer.
A blit option that copies the stencil portion of a combined depth and stencil texture to or from a buffer.
A resource that stores data in a format defined by your app.
The coordinates for the front upper-left corner of a region.
The y coordinate of the origin.
The z coordinate of the origin.
The dimensions of an object.
The number of elements in the z dimension.
The number of elements in the y dimension.
A resource that holds formatted image data.
A Boolean value that indicates whether the texture can only be used as a render target.
Describes an unsigned integer.
A signed integer value type.
